page.title: 20Pendomer & Halstock-Wildlife
page.content: A number of wildfowl, including mute swans, mallard, coot and great crested grebe, breed on Sutton Bingham reservoir, and cormorants are among other species regularly seen. In winter numbers and variety increase greatly, & the occasional rarity such as an osprey may be spotted. Badgers, foxes & roe deer are plentiful through out the area, the last named commonest in the woodlands. Gardeners are not too happy about the deer but are pleased to have plenty of slow worms, hedgehogs & toads. The birds are mainly the expected denizens of woods, open fields & gardens. There are buzzards in Pen Wood, jackdaws & wood- peckers in the trees near Halstock Church. Among summer migrants spotted flycatchers, swifts, house martins & swallows are plentiful. Cuckoos often heard, kestrals a familiar sight.
